オプション1: A month later, the raft was finished.
Star Man and the others kept practicing, testing, and improving with the raft.

At first they could row for only about an hour,
but by a month in, with breaks,
they could row for several hours.
They also tested how far they could travel in an hour.

Their cruising speed was about 2 km/h,
and they found it was impossible to arrive unless wind
and current were favorable.
That day, Star Man was loading the raft to depart.
When he finished loading, he looked back at the other two.
"Well then... I'm going to give it a try."
"...Yeah. Don't die."
None of the three were smiling.
A black vortex appeared, and the horned man emerged.
"Ah, uh, hello."
They all averted their gaze.
"You're having fun."
"Y-yes..."
"What are you trying to do?"
Tension ran between the three.

"We want to go outside and call for help.
And... I heard that if you leave the island,
the one-year-to-die contract goes away."

"That's not correct—it's not that the contract disappears.
The contract remains, but the procedures can no longer be carried out."
(By 'procedures,' he means the collection of my life.)
"If you succeed in escaping this island, I'll void your contract."
"Well, just because. Losing one contract isn't much of a loss to me."

"Besides, it would be troublesome if you used magic in the outside world
and became famous."
"Thank you."
"Thank you, Mr. Horns!"
Triangle Man said.
"Well then, I'll be taking my leave."
The horned man flew over to Square Man's grave.
He stood at the grave and looked at it for a moment.
Then the horned man returned into the black vortex.
